com.googlecode.cqengine.query

Class QueryFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.cqengine.query.QueryFactory

  • public class QueryFactory
extends Object
    A static factory for creating Query objects and its descendants.
    Author:
    Niall Gallagher

      • between

        public static <O,A extends Comparable<A>> Between<O,A> between(Attribute<O,A> attribute,
                                               A lowerValue,
                                               boolean lowerInclusive,
                                               A upperValue,
                                               boolean upperInclusive)
        Creates a Between query which asserts that an attribute is between a lower and an upper bound.
        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the attribute
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to which the query refers
        lowerValue - The lower bound to be asserted by the query
        lowerInclusive - Whether the lower bound is inclusive or not (true for "greater than or equal to")
        upperValue - The upper bound to be asserted by the query
        upperInclusive - Whether the upper bound is inclusive or not (true for "less than or equal to")
        Returns:
        A GreaterThan query

        Returns:
        An Or query comprised of several Equal queries

      • in

        public static <O,A> Or<O> in(Attribute<O,A> attribute,
             Collection<A> attributeValues)
        A shorthand way to create an Or query comprised of several Equal queries.

        Note that this can result in more efficient queries than several Equal queries "OR"ed together using other means.

        If the given attribute is a SimpleAttribute, this method will set a hint in the query to indicate that results for the child queries will inherently be disjoint and so will not require deduplication.

        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the attribute
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to which the query refers
        attributeValues - The potential values for the Equal queries to be asserted by the Or query
        Returns:
        An Or query comprised of several Equal queries

        public static <O,A extends CharSequence> StringMatchesRegex<O,A> matchesRegex(Attribute<O,A> attribute,
                                                              String regex)
        Creates a StringMatchesRegex query which asserts that an attribute's value matches a regular expression.

        To accelerate matchesRegex(...) queries, add a Standing Query Index on matchesRegex(...).

        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the attribute
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to which the query refers
        regex - The regular expression to be asserted by the query (this will be compiled via Pattern.compile(String))
        Returns:
        An StringStartsWith query

      • has

        public static <O,A> Has<O,A> has(Attribute<O,A> attribute)
        Creates an Has query which asserts that an attribute has a value (is not null).

        Asserts that an attribute has a value (is not null).

        To accelerate has(...) queries, add a Standing Query Index on has(...).

        To assert that an attribute does not have a value (is null), use not(has(...)).

        To accelerate not(has(...)) queries, add a Standing Query Index on not(has(...)).

        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the attribute
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to which the query refers
        Returns:
        An Has query

      • existsIn

        public static <O,F,A> Query<O> existsIn(IndexedCollection<F> foreignCollection,
                        Attribute<O,A> localKeyAttribute,
                        Attribute<F,A> foreignKeyAttribute)
        Creates a query supporting the equivalent of SQL EXISTS.

        Asserts that objects in a local IndexedCollection match objects in a foreign collection, based on a key attribute of local objects being equal to a key attribute of the foreign objects. This query can be performed on the local collection, supplying the foreign collection and the relevant attributes, as arguments to the query.

        This supports the SQL equivalent of:

         SELECT * From LocalCollection
 WHERE EXISTS (
     SELECT * FROM ForeignCollection
     WHERE LocalCollection.localAttribute = ForeignCollection.foreignAttribute
 )
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the local object
        F - The type of the foreign objects
        A - The type of the common attributes
        Parameters:
        foreignCollection - The collection of foreign objects
        localKeyAttribute - An attribute of the local object
        foreignKeyAttribute - An attribute of objects in the foreign collection
        Returns:
        A query which checks if the local object matches any objects in the foreign collection based on the given key attributes being equal

      • existsIn

        public static <O,F,A> Query<O> existsIn(IndexedCollection<F> foreignCollection,
                        Attribute<O,A> localKeyAttribute,
                        Attribute<F,A> foreignKeyAttribute,
                        Query<F> foreignRestrictions)
        Creates a query supporting the equivalent of SQL EXISTS, with some additional restrictions on foreign objects.

        Asserts that objects in a local IndexedCollection match objects in a foreign collection, based on a key attribute of local objects being equal to a key attribute of the foreign objects, AND objects in the foreign collection matching some additional criteria. This query can be performed on the local collection, supplying the foreign collection and the relevant attributes, as arguments to the query.

        This supports the SQL equivalent of:

         SELECT * From LocalCollection
 WHERE EXISTS (
     SELECT * FROM ForeignCollection
     WHERE LocalCollection.localAttribute = ForeignCollection.foreignAttribute
         AND ([AND|OR|NOT](ForeignCollection.someOtherAttribute = x) ...)
 )
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the local object
        F - The type of the foreign objects
        A - The type of the common attributes
        Parameters:
        foreignCollection - The collection of foreign objects
        localKeyAttribute - An attribute of the local object
        foreignKeyAttribute - An attribute of objects in the foreign collection
        foreignRestrictions - A query specifying additional restrictions on foreign objects
        Returns:
        A query which checks if the local object matches any objects in the foreign collection based on the given key attributes being equal

      • all

        public static <O> Query<O> all(Class<O> objectType)
        Creates a query which matches all objects in the collection.

        This is equivalent to a literal boolean 'true'.

        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the objects in the collection
        Returns:
        A query which matches all objects in the collection

        Returns:

      • orderBy

        public static <O> OrderByOption<O> orderBy(List<AttributeOrder<O>> attributeOrders)
        Creates an OrderByOption query option, encapsulating the given list of AttributeOrder objects which pair an attribute with a preference to sort results by that attribute in either ascending or descending order.
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing the attributes
        Parameters:
        attributeOrders - The list of attribute orders by which objects should be sorted
        Returns:
        An OrderByOption query option, requests results to be sorted in the given order

      • orderBy

        public static <O> OrderByOption<O> orderBy(AttributeOrder<O>... attributeOrders)
        Creates an OrderByOption query option, encapsulating the given list of AttributeOrder objects which pair an attribute with a preference to sort results by that attribute in either ascending or descending order.
        Type Parameters:

        Returns:
        An OrderByOption query option, requests results to be sorted in the given order

      • ascending

        public static <O> AttributeOrder<O> ascending(Attribute<O,? extends Comparable> attribute)
        Creates an AttributeOrder object which pairs an attribute with a preference to sort results by that attribute in ascending order. These AttributeOrder objects can then be passed to the orderBy(com.googlecode.cqengine.query.option.AttributeOrder[]) method to create a query option which sorts results by the indicated attributes and ascending/descending preferences.
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing the attributes
        Parameters:
        attribute - An attribute to sort by
        Returns:
        An AttributeOrder object, encapsulating the attribute and a preference to sort results by it in ascending order

      • descending

        public static <O> AttributeOrder<O> descending(Attribute<O,? extends Comparable> attribute)
        Creates an AttributeOrder object which pairs an attribute with a preference to sort results by that attribute in descending order. These AttributeOrder objects can then be passed to the orderBy(com.googlecode.cqengine.query.option.AttributeOrder[]) method to create a query option which sorts results by the indicated attributes and ascending/descending preferences.
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing the attributes
        Parameters:
        attribute - An attribute to sort by
        Returns:
        An AttributeOrder object, encapsulating the attribute and a preference to sort results by it in descending order

      • orderingStrategy

        public static <O> OrderingStrategyOption orderingStrategy(OrderingStrategy orderingStrategy)
        Creates an OrderingStrategyOption query option, encapsulating a given OrderingStrategy, which when supplied to the query engine requests it to use the given strategy to order results.
        Parameters:
        orderingStrategy - The ordering strategy the query engine should use
        Returns:
        An OrderingStrategyOption query option

      • deduplicate

        public static DeduplicationOption deduplicate(DeduplicationStrategy deduplicationStrategy)
        Creates a DeduplicationOption query option, encapsulating a given DeduplicationStrategy, which when supplied to the query engine requests it to eliminate duplicates objects from the results returned using the strategy indicated.
        Parameters:
        deduplicationStrategy - The deduplication strategy the query engine should use
        Returns:
        A DeduplicationOption query option, requests duplicate objects to be eliminated from results

      • isolationLevel

        public static IsolationOption isolationLevel(IsolationLevel isolationLevel)
        Creates a IsolationOption query option, encapsulating a given IsolationLevel, which when supplied to the query engine requests that level of transaction isolation.
        Parameters:
        isolationLevel - The transaction isolation level to request
        Returns:
        An IsolationOption query option

      • argumentValidation

        public static ArgumentValidationOption argumentValidation(ArgumentValidationStrategy strategy)
        Creates an ArgumentValidationOption query option, encapsulating a given ArgumentValidationStrategy, which when supplied to the query engine requests that some argument validation may be disabled (or enabled) for performance or reliability reasons.
        Parameters:
        strategy - The argument validation strategy to request
        Returns:
        An ArgumentValidationOption query option

      • queryOptions

        public static QueryOptions queryOptions(Object... queryOptions)
        A convenience method to encapsulate several objects together as QueryOptions, where the class of the object will become its key in the QueryOptions map.
        Parameters:
        queryOptions - The objects to encapsulate as QueryOptions
        Returns:
        A QueryOptions object

      • queryOptions

        public static QueryOptions queryOptions(Collection<Object> queryOptions)
        A convenience method to encapsulate a collection of objects as QueryOptions, where the class of the object will become its key in the QueryOptions map.
        Parameters:
        queryOptions - The objects to encapsulate as QueryOptions
        Returns:
        A QueryOptions object

      • noQueryOptions

        public static QueryOptions noQueryOptions()
        A convenience method to encapsulate an empty collection of objects as QueryOptions.
        Returns:
        A QueryOptions object
